name: Semantic Self-Similarity Axiom
intent: Formalize self-similarity of semantic systems across scales and link it to fractal structure.
constraints: There exists a family of semantic systems S\_n and scale maps σ\_{n-\>n+1}: S\_n \-\> S\_{n+1} preserving the Tri-Unity structure.
There exist isomorphisms (up to rescaling) θ\_n: S\_0 \-\> S\_n such that θ\_{n+1} ≈ σ\_{n-\>n+1} ∘ θ\_n.
Semantic invariants (e.g. classes of meaningful deviations, stable truth sets) are preserved up to scaling across n.
The induced geometric embedding of these invariants exhibits fractal structure (self-similarity at multiple scales).
